Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Katarina L
Reviews.Content: No cleaning, no service, no hot water, no hair-dryer, no breakfast. I do not recommend (but for the location, very close to shops!)

Reviews.Title: “"hotel of horrors"”
Reviews.Author: Giulia751
Reviews.Content: Alarm bells went off when we saw the cracked plastic sign over the street entrance on Upper Berkeley Street, and our apprehension only deepened on ascending the ratty red carpet up to the reception. We were shown three rooms, one more dismal than the next, and --because we were prepaid and couldn't escape--we finally settled on the least objectionable and quietest. Still, the bathroom was filthy and its walls afflicted with a thick black mold, the wallpaper in the bedroom was pocked and peeling, the curtain on the back window torn, the coffee-colored and obscenely stained blanket full of cigarette holes, and the bedsprings--evidently from Dickensian times--creaked ominously. During the entire four nights we spent there, certainly a Guiness record in wanton masochism, the room was cleaned not even once, and the sheets changed only on the last day. When the temperature plunged at night, we turned on the prehistoric heater, only to be met with a blast of stinking air; evidently the mold had invaded its innards. We are seasoned tourists, and this grim and grubby facility (to say hotel would be a ridiculous exaggeration) was by far the worst we have ever experienced. Fellow travelers beware! P. S. To its credit, this establishment does evidence a playful kind of gallows humor, as they have put a sign reading "Rated on Tripadvisor.com.uk" on their front window!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: keithtrim_58
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was absolutely disgusting. The stairs didn't look as if they had been vacuumed EVER. Even the step outside the hotel was covered in what looked like stripped paint. My room was at the very top of the hotel and there was a ladder up to the attic at the top of the stairs that was down all the time. My room was only serviced once during my 4 night stay and they never emptied the bin or changed the towels. Pros: The sheets and towels were clean (at first) and the shower worked. Cons: Literally everything else. Find somewhere else. Even the location doesn't save it.

Reviews.Title: “The set from "Bottom"”
Reviews.Author: Bovril1
Reviews.Content: So creatively dirty that it became entertaining. My particular favourite was the toilet rolls used to prop open windows so they would not fall in on themselves. The lock on the door did not work so sleep (fully clothed of course) was the luxury item I needed to sacrifice. Police cell would be preferable. Strathbungo, No Bawbags!

Reviews.Title: “high tech and state of the art contraptions”
Reviews.Author: waggespudel
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is set up with any kind of high tech and state of the art contraptions. As soon as you walk into the room you notice the creative work of solving problems needed to be fixed. The really ancient window which looks like it's going to break any second if a bird touched it with its wing is therefore so dirty that you barely can look outside. Not a problem since the view outside is rather obstructed with an old and run-down balcony. Not to mention the modern way the window's incapability of closing and opening it was fixed by a subtle paper bag that cracks the window open a couple inches resisting extreme weather conditions and not letting in any warmth during night. The moldy, off-coming plaster on the ceiling was professionally fixed with sellotape and nicely re-designed by letting some of it dangling. The color of the gum stuck on the floor leading to the bathroom indicates a high number of guests it probably brought domestic bless and the last deep-cleaning was done before some of us were even born. First impression of the bathroom was quite okay. The in-built in the wall shower head is ultra-flexible due to its lacking attachment and some loose screws (I recommend wearing a helmet in the near future using this shower). No doubt this hotel plays a leading role in the fight of global warming and environment protection! For the fact there's no hot or even lukewarm water guests shower less frequently and most of all much shorter. Who needs warm water to shower?! For those of you who like to clean their feet once in a while this hotel holds a special invention for you in store. If you got too cold feet to take a shower there's water leaking from a little hole on the outside of the toilet accumulating in front of the sink. This 'Eau de Toilette' presents a perfect way of keeping your feet fresh and 'clean'. If you're planning on staying with company, I recommend using the night as an opportunity to talk about everything under the sun since you won't be getting any sleep in this rather uncomfortable bed ( I got better sleep by spending the night on the bare floor). Or it's because of the mold spread all over the room.

Reviews.Title: “You canÂ´t trust this hotel - do not make a reservation!”
Reviews.Author: AndreKorsaksel
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel donÂ´t care if you bring a reservation, and do not appologise that the hotel is overbooked. We had to find at new hiotel late at night friday night, and it was not easy! The same happend to the people who came after us, so it was not a sort of mistake I guess. Stay away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only adventage”
Reviews.Author: jaamm
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights because it was walking distance from where I needed to be. We were given a room in the basement. The hotel itself and our room were extremely unclean (just grubby). There are no wardrobes just a hook on the wall to hang clothes. There is no restaurant/breakfast in the hotel so information on their website is false. No tea/coffee making facilities. Service is very basic (two ladies at the reception desk/one per shift) and you need to do everything yourself. The only thing they do is replacement of tovels. Room / Bathroom / toilet not cleaned during the day. No shampoo in bathroom. The only thing good was that the location was great. However otherwise stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thank god the nightmare is over”
Reviews.Author: bridgeHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The biggest mistake we could have made. The hotel was extremely unclean and dilapadated. The sheets had stains on them, the bathroom tiles were cracked and had something like mould growing in the shower. We had to change rooms because our toilet was clogged and even worse when we checked into our new room the toliet seat had not been properly cleaned. The heating is switched off at night so it gets extremely cold. The only thing good was that the receptionist who checked us in was very nice and the location was nice. However otherwise stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a dump”
Reviews.Author: Smudges-dad
Reviews.Content: Where can I start? On the upside, the location is great, near Marble Arch and Edgeware Road. However, surley reception staff, dirty room (not unheigenicly dirty, just grubby), mildew in bathroom, noisy corridors, window frame broken, small portable TV with snow for a pictire and no batteries in the remote. Bed uncomfortable with springs that went boing every time you turned over. Bathroom / toilet not cleaned during the day. No shampoo in bathroom, toilet paper so thin you needed 4 sheets at a time. I stayed 3 nights because it was 3 minutes walk from where I needed to be, and as I was out from 7.30am to 9.30pm every day, I didn't walk out straight away. On a philosophical level, there need to be hotels like this to ensure you appreciate other hotels more.

Reviews.Title: “This place is disgusting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: juliefromcov
Reviews.Content: We went to this 'Hotel' as part of a hen weekend, the person who had booked it had arranged that we would be able to leave our bags in a room as we could not book in until 3pm & they would not let us pay until after 3pm too. Well when we went in it looked dirty in the hallway but i thought this was just that the cleaners were about to start cleaning. When we finally went back later & got in to our rooms i was disgusted at the state of it, it smelt very bad. the bathroom was filthy, no blind at the window & a curtain pole that looked like if we had used it it would have fallen down, no sink plug, a dirty toilet brush was in there too. The room itself was supposed to be a double......with a 3/4 bed that had the thinnest cheapest awful mattress on it. There are no wardrobes just a hook under the TV to hang clothes. The TV was out of focus, the tv remote had no batteries or back on so could not be used. The dÃ©cor was filthy, dust all over the place, the windows do not look like they have ever been cleaned & the sash windows were awful. The view we had from the window was disgusting. There are no tea/coffee making facilities. At Â£70 for 2 people with no breakfast i think the owner is an up to date Robin Hood. I went down to speak to the lady in reception & she said that they do not have tea/coffee making facilities i said i did not know how they felt that they could charge what they were for such a dirty place. my friend asked for her money back & was told they do not return money. This place (note i will not say hotel) needs to be struck off any advertising website, it is disgraceful that it can even be called a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the staff very bad”
Reviews.Author: mateoSouthAmerica
Reviews.Content: mr manager I want to make a complaint about staff who are in reception, then stay a few days i was there served me a very pretty young lady her name is LIGA at first I felt my flirting and flattered me I made some complaints about the room and told me that the maintenance man was there, but never tended my complaint until I went and saw the man after playing with it in a way irespetuosa for work and the guest would like to know how to have that kind staff please note this claim

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay! Need something to spoil your trip to London? Go there!”
Reviews.Author: CalBear_Stuttgart
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience! Booking the hotel on the internet we thought that we had made a good deal: Quite cheap hotel, nothing luxury but just ok for a three day trip to London and at least very well located. Getting to the hotel, it was everything but a good deal. First of all the whole hotel was smelling. We got there in the morning and had to leave our luggage downstairs. The smell almost made us fall down the stairs. Coming back to the hotel at night we had to find out that our room was not only small but freezing cold, walls and bed covers just dirty and above all there was not even a window that could be opened. Just imagine yourself how much fresh air this room must have seen in the years or probably decades since the house was built... When complaining to the staff and asking for another room we stepped into the next problem: The staff did hardly speak any English. Finally we were promised another room for the last of our three nights - but unfortunately staff forgot about that again... Needless to say that the bathroom was not even cleaned once and our towels were not even changed once during our three day stay. I was planning to have a nice Easter weekend at London with my girlfriend, this hotel really spoiled our trip! We would have changed the hotel after the first night but due to the fact that it was Easter weekend all places at reasonable pricing were completely booked. Only few rooms at really expensive hotels were left, we were very close to spend around two hundred pounds per night for a room at another hotel... Oh and I almost forgot - at Berkeley Court they make you pay the complete stay when checking in. That's probably due to the fact that otherwise nobody would ever stay there. We definitely wouldn't! Do yourself a favor and don't stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: pats07
Reviews.Content: we didnt book this hotel originally, we were sent here by a sister hotel as they didnt have our booking. we were told it was a nice hotel---total lie! we got there early and the man at the desk confirmed we had book a family room with 4 beds and a double room for the 6 of us. he said we couldnt check in because it was too early so we left our bags in a room which he said would be locked and then wasn't. we came back later that evening and a different woman said that they had given away our room to an agency booking that came in that monring even though the man had confirmed it to us thatmorning. they squeezed a camp bed into the family room with 5 beds now, totally against all health and safety and fire regulations and someone was meant to sleep on their own in a single room. the receptionist was so rude and unapologetic for giving away our room and offered a pathetic discount, we refused to pay wat she expected! the single room had no sink, toilet or shower. the shower on that floor had no door so impossible to have a shower. the family room was cramped and there were cigarette burns in the sheets in a no smoking hotel. the room was freezing and there were only 2 sheets as a cover...ridiculous. the shower in the family room was dirty and once turned on the water was scadling, no joke, had to jump out of shower it actually gave one the girls 3rd degree burns, we couldnt turn off shower as ew could put our hand under scalding water and the steam filled the toom and set off fire alarm, the receptionist tried to help and nearly broke her neck by slipping in shower! herself and another woman just laughed and thought it was hilarious and were in no way sorry for the inconvience or injury! they had no first aid kit for burns cream apparently they had 'just run out' another violation of health nad safety. the only other shower to use was the one with no door. the location was alright but that does not compensate in any way ofr hte hotel, its absolute crap and i wouldnt wish a stay in here on my worst enemy!!!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: leedsqueen
Reviews.Content: loction of hotel was great. hotel was clean, Also staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Shorti
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were asked to check our rooms, before handing over the money, at a quick glance they looked okay. For the price and location, it looked good. But on a closer inspection, we noticed stains on the head board, sheets and towels. It looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. I'm a cleaner myself, it was my worse nightmare. There was a massive damp spot on the ceiling, that didn't look safe, and the windows only opened a couple of inches. I was the first one to use the toilet, and someone had left a "surprise" in there and hadn't flushed. That said it all, that it hadn't been cleaned at all. Our shower was leaking in the bathroom and leaking out to our room. The bed was lumpy, and we were absolutely freezing, we had to put extra jumpers, socks etc on to keep warm. We were told the hotel was safe, and someone would let us in, when we came back from our night out. However we walked in and there were no questions asked. We were then woken up at 7.30am, with a toilet roll set alight outside our rooms!!! We called the man from downstairs, but he didn't understand what we were saying, and just gave us another toilet roll. When we left the hotel, we complained to the fella on the front desk, however he kept "saying he did not care". We were not leaving london til 430pm however we did not leaving our suitcases in that, unsafe, dirty hotel. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to ANYONE. I can't believe they haven't been shut down already. NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: frog72
Reviews.Content: We did not expect the greatest hotel in London, however this one turned out to be cold and dirty, with total lack of assistance from the personnel in charge. The bathroom has not been cleaned during our entire stay of 4 nights. We had to ask for the towels replacement and to get an extra blanket we had to argue with the receptionist. The sole positive aspect is the location which is very close to Marble Arch Tube Station.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - great location - over-charged for the value”
Reviews.Author: jlm318
Reviews.Content: top floor room - they said it was the only one available with private bath - 5th floor by American counting - steep stairs with shallow steps, had to step sideways going down. Not very safe. Glad there wasn't a fire and I wouldn't put it past a place like that to have a fire. no toilet paper. we had to ask at the desk (4 floors down) - clerk gave us an open roll that was sitting beside him. Obviously it was a normal thing for him. He said that 'she forgot' - meaning the maid, I assumed. our room looked fairly clean and adequate at first glance, tho very small but we wanted to be very near hyde park, so accepted that this might mean some compromises. I hadn't read this so didn't know about the bedbugs or hair. I did not get any bites or find any disgusting surprises, but didn't look for them. My friend's bed was so uncomfortable that she had unaccustomed back pain after the first night that increased each night. My bed was nothing special but ok. it did make a lot of noise every time i moved, so it didn't help my friend to sleep cause i move a lot. It looked like the room had been cleaned at least superficially. But after we checked in, it was never cleaned. no drinking glass in bathroom. shower door falling apart. no place to hang coats except one broken wall hanger with one wire hanger - in a twin room that will obviously house 2 people. windows boarded shut at about 6 inches max opening. no AC. thankfully it was not very warm because the street was so noisy that we could not even leave this open. i asked for a fan but never got it. my friend wanted an extra blanket and was told it would be taken up, but when we got back to the room, it was not there and she had to go down those famous stairs for it. I shamed the middle aged Iraqi owner into carrying up the luggage - the young Chinese reception staff would not even consider carrying luggage. They were very smiley and superficially polite but little came of it.

Reviews.Title: “Messed around, sworn at, don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharpe79
Reviews.Content: For a start we arrived and were then sent to a sister 'hotel' as they didn't have the booking, even though it had been confirmed twice!!! Sister hotel in noisy location, broken fan, dodgy tv and aerial connection, dodgy shower, disgusting fridge. The second day we went back to original to sort out a key for some other friends coming for a room (also booked). We were left waiting at recption while the guy on reception chatted to his friend on the phone. 10minutes later we finally got to talk to him. He couldn't give us a key as the cleaner was at the sister hotel with the keys, but we could get it off him. When we asked if he could phone to confirm with the cleaner he said he had no credit in his phone and the 'hotel' phone only takes incoming calls. When we asked where the cleaner would be, we got the following reply 'in your F*CKING room'. So as a a customer asking reasonable questions we were sworn at. So back to sister hotel....on the way we phoned Hotels.com as it was booked through them. They denied knowledge of the booking at first. So to the cleaner...we found him, but he said he couldn't give us the key as he only had one and had to return them to the Berkeley. Hang on we were told to com back here to get it from you!!! Thoroughly annoyed, we met our friends and headed back to the Berkeley, where they now said they could house our friends, not in the sister 'hotel'. Dizzy??? Yes it really was this much hassle. Luckily we had a couple of hours to mess about with all this! Now onto the Berkeley...the room didn't lock(!), the lamp starting smoking when switched on, the window didn't open to let shower steam out, the twin bed turned out to be a double, with a camp bed (with no covers). Overall, poor rooms, DISGRACEFUL staff. On the plus side, close to Hyde Park and cheap, but i'd rather spend the extra next time

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad - great value for money when you're just going to sleep and shower there anyway...”
Reviews.Author: TotalViking
Reviews.Content: You can't expect too much from a budget hotel, and if you have astma or is allergy prone - sorry, you just have to book something fancier... After having read all these gruesome reviews, I was a bit discouraged... I actually didn 't read them until very close to departure and didn't have other "options" within budget. Me and my sister left for London trembling, but that was uncalled for! Sure, some of the staff members aren't 100% attentive, but the "night guy" - a real doll! We got to see our room before checking in, all was fine, (we even had extra towels and soaps :-) fancy that!). It's close to Oxford Street for shopping, Hyde Park for relaxation and Marble Arch Underground station (on the red, central line) for when you want to move around London. I'll book this hotel again next time I go!

Reviews.Title: “The worst service , rudest receptionist and dirtiest hotel over the world”
Reviews.Author: asoco
Reviews.Content: Checking in this hotel was more than a nightmare. First of all, the attitude the receptionist (a young guy around his twenties, wearing glasses and Asian face) to a bewildered guest was the worst for a hotel staff member to my knowledge. To call this place as a hotel is REALLY, REALLY an ABUSE of the word. I will never forget the horrible experience I had in this terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “The crummiest dump I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: tifosi678
Reviews.Content: I wish that I had read the reviews here before checking into this sorry excuse for a hotel, from which I am typing this review. It is laughable that they charge people money to stay in this dump - guests should be paid for actually staying here. I had originally been booked into the Ivanhoe Suite through our corporate travel agent. I now understand that place is (or was) just as bad. As it would appear to be in common ownership, I have no doubt that was the case. On arrival at the Ivanhoe Suite, I found it to be closed down. A notice on the door asked guests to phone an 020 number. After doing so, I was told to go to the Berkeley Court hotel where I would be checked in and would receive credit for the taxi fare over. How I wish I had refused this offer... It is truly dire. I should have been suspicious when I was asked to pay for the room before I even got to see it. It's the "policy of the hotel that all accounts are settled on arrival", according to notices in 'reception'. I can well understand why. To say that the place is the crummiest dump that I have ever stayed in is a huge understatement. In summary: - The bed is unmade and looks like it has probably been slept in by about six guests before me - Used, damp towels remained in the bathroom and on the floor of the bathroom. I asked for fresh towels and was handed one bath towel of dubious quality - There is no wardrobe - There is uncollected rubbish in the room - The room does not look it has been cleaned, well, ever! - Paint is flaking from the ceiling, etc - I would not be surprised to come across rats - The bathroom floor houses a collection of interesting bugs The staff seem unconcerned about any of this. Unfortunately, this stay in on my employer and I have paid upfront. Even though I wouldn't be able to recoup any additional expenditure on an alternative hotel, I have looked around seriously and am dismayed that nothing else is available in the area with a rack rate of less than Â£250. Even at that rate, serious consideration has been given to leaving early. If I had a dog, I wouldn't board it here. Truly shocking.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: Jazmyne979
Reviews.Content: We STILL have welts from bed bugs. I squashed several on the sheets one morning, leaving bloody bug bits behind, and we put the box from the antibacterial cream next to them so the maid would see and change the sheets, and she just put my PILLOW on top! The bathroom was moldy, there was no hot water the entire four days we were there (ONLY because we were having trouble finding another place to stay for so long at such short notice), there were other people's hairs and things on the walls of the bathroom... when we got there, the beds were on end, with the previous occupants' dirty laundry in the corner. We had to take a walk while they cleaned the room. Mom had to go to the hospital for an allergic reaction to the bed bugs. As we left to find another hotel, citing bed bugs to be the reason for leaving, we received a sarcastic "awww." in parting. Whoever owns this hotel should be ashamed and outraged that this goes on. DO NOT stay here. Go with Hotel Ibis, or Premier Inn, or Best Western; all of which have comparable room prices, even near the heart of London.

Reviews.Title: “Probably dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: LondonTurks
Reviews.Content: Probably the Dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed since my Inter-rail backpacking days is Berkeley Court Hotel in London! Although the hotel is newly furnished (a couple of years ago) I do not think the bathroom has ever been cleaned! I had to ask for the sheets to be replaced as there were hair on them and the new ones had stains as well! The staff was not helpful at all, I had to carry 2 suitcases myself to the 3rd floor room via very narrow and steep steps! The stairs had a leak and it was smelling disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: cnc7
Reviews.Content: Booked for 5 nights but left after one night. The room is dirty, everything is dirty. No clean sheets. Even as dirty tissue on the table. It is worse than youth hostel. The toilet is extremely dirty with stain all over and no toilet paper. Really noisy at night as it's located next to a bar/cafe. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: Mehran67
Reviews.Content: Had the misfortune of staying here on monday night,absolute farce that people would have to pay money to stay in this poor excuse for a hotel. To say staff were incompetent is being kind. There was a definite language barrier with staff, although not all as I can see from previous comments which one can only assume they have left themselves. Rooms were not serviced adequately ie unmade beds, dirty glasses, bathroom.. I can't even begin to convey the state of bathrooms. Staff did not believe this to be a major issue. I also, on leaving, experienced the staff dealing with a guest whose room would not lock as the lock was broken, they offered no remuneration for this absolute paramount of features of a hotel room, particularly in a city such as London. shockingly bad. If you are even looking for a basic get away, seek elsewhere for cheaper and you will definitely get something far better for your money

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Mehran67
Reviews.Content: Had the misfortune of staying here on monday night,absolute farce that people would have to pay money to stay in this poor excuse for a hotel. To say staff were incompetent is being kind. There was a definite language barrier with staff, although not all as I can see from previous comments which one can only assume they have left themselves. Rooms were not serviced adequately ie unmade beds, dirty glasses, bathroom.. I can't even begin to convey the state of bathrooms. Staff did not believe this to be a major issue. I also, on leaving, experienced the staff dealing with a guest whose room would not lock as the lock was broken, they offered no remuneration for this absolute paramount of features of a hotel room, particularly in a city such as London. shockingly bad. If you are even looking for a basic get away, seek elsewhere for cheaper and you will definitely get something far better for your money

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: NLoGalway
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at this hotel in january 2008 and found the location perfect for what we came to london to do-shop!!! The hotel is situated at the top of oxford street less than 5 minute walk to the shops. The nearest tube station is marbel arch and is extremely useful to explore london!! The hotel itself is very basic and the staff are fine. One of our rooms was an okay size but the other was very small and after a days shopping it becomes increasingly smaller with the bags clothes etc....!!! All in all this hotel is perfect for those wanting to shop and to spend the minimum amount of money on accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ecnerwalma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truely awful! Our booking paperwork clearly stated that we had breakfast included, when we asked about the time breakfast was served we were told that the hotel had not served breakfast for the past two years! There was no milk available with the tea and coffee making facilities and when we requested some milk we were told that there was none available! We were woken at 6.30am both Saturday and Sunday morning by a very loud sqeeking noise coming from the bathroom. This noise prevented us from getting any further sleep omce it had started. We were informed that this noise was due to a fault with the boiler and someone was coming to fix it...however no one came to do this during our entire stay! And to top it all off there was no hot water in the hotel from waking on Saturday morning until we left on Sunday morning!! The hotel isn't overly clean either. The staff are not very helpful and the management were unsympathetic to our complaint, did not offer any apology and refused to offer any acceptable financial compensation for the terrible service we expereinced. A Â£10 'goodwill gesture' hardly covered two distrubed nights sleep and no hot water. I recommend that no one books to stay in this hotel!!

HotelInfo.Name: Berkeley Court
HotelInfo.Address: 22 Upper Berkeley Street, London W1H 7PF, England
